title: PM Modi meets members of 1996 World Cup-Winning Sri Lankan cricket team
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday interacted with members of the 1996 World Cup-winning Sri Lankan cricket team and said the triumph captured the imagination of countless sports lovers.

title: Thousands protest against Trump and Musk in ’Hands Off!’ rallies across US and Europe
byline: Tens of thousands of protesters have taken part in an anti-Trump protest in a score of locations across the US in what organisers expect to be the largest single day of protest against President Donald Trump and his billionaire ally Elon Musk.

title: Fire breaks out at Borella function hall
byline: A fire broke out at a function hall on Castle Street, Borella, last night and later extinguished.

title: Some 50,000 kgs shrimp meant for destruction found heading to market
byline: A stock of 50,000 kilograms of large shrimp, previously recommended for destruction, was discovered stored in two containers and being transported to the Peliyagoda Fish Market Complex, allegedly to be sold to the public.

title: Police probe alleged sexual assault by doctor at Negombo Hospital
byline: The Negombo Police have initiated an investigation following a complaint received at the Police Headquarters regarding an alleged sexual assault at the Negombo General Hospital.

title: PM Modi concludes visit, emplanes for India
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded his state visit and emplaned for India.

title: Will question Govt on agreements signed with India in Parliament next week: Harsha
byline: We intend questioning the government in Parliament on the agreements it has signed with India during the visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, when it meets on Tuesday, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harsha de Silva said today.

title: India’s rivers are home to 6,000 dolphins - but they are in trouble
byline: India’s longest and most holy river, the Ganges, is home to thousands of dolphins. But their survival is under threat.

title: India-Sri Lanka Defence MoU in accordance with international best practices – Defence Secretary
byline: Any cooperation activities undertaken under the proposed MoU will be in accordance with international best practices and will not conflict with the domestic laws and national policies of either Sri Lanka or India, according to Defence Secretary Sampath Thuyacontha.

title: Over 600 complaints related to LG elections
byline: A total of 74 fresh complaints related to the upcoming Local Government elections were received, taking the total number to over 600.

title: Sri Lanka frees 11 Indian fishermen after PM Modi’s appeal
byline: Sri Lanka has set at least 11 Indian fishermen free, in a goodwill gesture.

title: No wigs please - the new rules shaking up beauty pageants
byline: Long, flowing wigs and weave extensions have dominated the catwalks of Ivory Coast’s massively popular beauty pageants for years.

title: Indian woman arrested at Katunayake airport with Rs. 65 Mn worth of cocaine
byline: An Indian woman was arrested at Katunayake Airport this morning (06) by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau with cocaine worth Rs. 65 million.

title: Welikada Police face scrutiny over death of youth in custody
byline: The Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP), Priyantha Weerasuriya, has recommended to the National Police Commission that the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Welikada Police Station be transferred to enable an impartial inquiry into the death of 26-year-old Sathsara Nimesh, who died while in police custody at the Welikada Police Station.
